results.title: Champions in the sun
results.creator_credit: Riddell Black, Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: Describes the Royal Highland Show at Ingliston near Edinburgh. Cattle and sheep are judged by experts, and sequences describe the background of some of the pedigree animals, explaining the features which are expected in stock of this quality. Also includes show, crafts and bands. Narrated by Douglas Murchie.

results.title: The Chameleon
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films and Films of Africa
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the chameleon, film in its natural habitat in Rhodesia. General and close-up shots illustrate the animal’s appearance and movements, details of feet and eye movements, colour changes of the skin in response to light and temperament. Normal and slow-motion photography shows the action of the tongue in catching insect food. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Challenge in the desert
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: After assisting Libya to gain independence in 1951, the United Nations has continued to give technical assistance to develop the country. As much of the land is unsuitable for cultivation, future prosperity depends on improving crops. Cooperatives for the citrus fruit and sheep industries have been formed and reforestation and irrigation projects are under way.

results.title: Ceylon: the new dominion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
A survey of the history and position (as at 1948) of Ceylon (Sri Lanka), the newest Dominion of the British Commonwealth. Shows the civilization of the Lion People who invaded Ceylon from Northern India; the influence of Portugese and Dutch colonization which preceded British rule. The achievements of a 150 years of British rule are evaluated. The practical results of British government in terms of increased production of tea, rubber and coconuts are illustrated. Shows the modern educational system; defeat of malaria; extension of irrigation and recolonization of the north; difficulties facing the new Dominion. The population of six and a half million people is made up of five races with four religions and three languages. Poverty, lack of finance, high cost of imported food are barriers to progress, but progressive social schemes have been started.

results.title: Central America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography of the Americas”.
Describes the three main topographical regions of Central America - hot lowlands, temperate plateau, and cool mountain lands. Shows effects of climate on inhabitants and crops. Shows how coffee is grown and shipped. Discusses the economic importance of the Panama Canal.

results.title: Ceiling with scrapite finish
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plastering”.
One of a series of four films which gives a basic training in plastering as applied to building construction. The use of expanded metal lathing is demonstrated and the way in which the plaster adheres to it. Three coats are applied, render, float and set. The making of dots and screeds is shown. Before the final coat is applied the cornice is run. The method of cutting the mould for this and the addition of horse and handle is shown. Screeds and running rule are fitted in position and the cornice is run. Finally, the finishing coat is applied to the ceiling.

results.title: Caverns and geysers
results.brief_description: Illustrates how underground water is constantly changing our earth. We see the results of its action in limestone regions where underground water has dissolved out large caverns. In a few areas we see spectacular hot springs and geysers, created when volcanic rock heats water under the ground. Filmed with the co-operation of Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Sequoia National Park and Yellowstone National Park.

results.title: Cave temples of India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A vivid reminder of a great past when people created miracles in stone to express devotion to their gods. Shows some of the famous rock-cut shrines, including the caves at Badami, Elephanta and Ellora, dating from the 17th century. Explains the statues depicting the various incarnations of the Hindu deity. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.

results.title: Cattle country
results.brief_description: This film provides information on the beef cattle industry in Australia. It presents a general picture of beef cattle types, including the major British breeds, some tropical breeds, and the European exotics, now making their appearance in the country. Intended in particular for students and young farmers. No further credits available.
